intro: Xyris pulchella, commonly known as the pretty yellow-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Xyridaceae family and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces clusters of bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Xyris pulchella typically grows in wetland habitats, including marshes and swamps, where it thrives in moist, sandy soils. It plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining the ecological balance of its wetland environment.
